subject: UnChained
event:
The episode I scripted for the third season of GAME OF THRONES has undergone another title change.  "Chains" is out.  It was a pretty good title, but an even better one, even more apt, presented itself when D&D shuffled a few scenes between episodes, so episode 307 is now...

... no, I don't think I'll tell.  Best wait to HBO announces all ten of the episode titles.  I mean, the title has already changed twice, I would rather not have to make another post if it changes again.

I lost a title, but gained a song.

comments.article: The Bear and the Maiden Fair I hope?? :))
That would indicate the Purple Wedding, which is sometime after the Red Wedding, which is towards the end...
Rains of Castamere?
rains of castamere...? Too obvious..
comments.subject: mmm ... an unchained melody

comments.article:
George, man! You fiend!

At this point in Season 1 and 2's dev cycle, we knew the names of your episodes and vaguely knew what part of the story you were handling.

Why so much secrecy this time around? Oh wait,... we're talking about George RR Martin here.

Thank you again for putting so many turtle species in your book series, from one chelonian loving freak to another I assume.
I second that hope!
The Dornishman's Wife? ;-)
The Last of the Giants?
comments.subject: Maybe it is..

comments.article: Shuffling scenes? So I take it they added a scene to your episode that you didn't write? Hrm. Also, last minute shuffling of scenes doesn't seem like a good thing to me...
comments.subject: Shuffling

comments.article: Happens all the time on any serial drama.  Less so with episodics.
comments.subject: Re: Shuffling

comments.article: A bear there was. A bear, A BEAR!

I'm thinking it's something to do with Rains of Castamere.  Shuffling scenes between episodes is less of a concern than there being a mere 10 episodes to convey SO MUCH!!  They can NOT cut, the red weeding, the purple wedding OR the huge event at the Aerie or certainly they will end the season with the Epilogue scene! I get chills when I think of it. Each of those events evoke such raw emotion, they could not leave them out.. could they?
Don't worry. Those epic scenes will happen this season. RW specially. They know what they're doing. In these guys we trust.
You guys realize that season 3 is only half of 'A Storm of Swords' right?
comments.subject: Steel and Snow

comments.article: The first title of this episode was Autumn Rain if I remember correctly. The first song related to rain that comes to my mind is the Rains of Castamere. However, I don't really see what could happened in an episode with this title.
comments.subject: Rain

comments.article: You'd be very surprised, I would not google anything to do this season, but just think about the lyrics to the song.
comments.subject: Re: Rain

comments.article: I can see Jaime topping many peoples list of favorite characters this season. He's definitely in my top 5.
comments.subject: I dreamed of you.

comments.article: Yes ASoS is being cut into 2 seasons. And I don't understand why everyone is so confused about seeing Theon. In a dance of Dragons we learned what was happening to him through memorys, he didn't simply take a holidays to the summer isles and come back as Reek in ADwD. We are going to see how he became Reek (keep Alfie employed) and keep us on our toes. (how many do we have now?)

The same is happening with the title of Neil Gaiman's Doctor Who episode this season, which was "The Last Cyberman" but now he says he's thought of a better one. That's why I don't put reported episode titles on my calendar until the ones before them have been confirmed.

This news makes me more excited!
Djaime Unchained?  =D

maybe not known Stateside,Jerome Flynn (Bronn) had massive UK no 1 hit,'Unchained Melody'.Good to see he has not lost his voice when Bronn sang in Lannister barracks. Jerome just finished a new success tv series here 'Ripper Street' set in London six months after Jack the Ripper murders stopped.But I cannot figure the irascible Bronn singing in series 3. Now, if Jerome had been cast as Mance, then his singing talent could have really shone![I still love his Bronn]!
comments.subject: mmm... 'unchained'... stretching a bit but..

comments.article: Tease.
off topic perhaps but I really covet your emoticons.  Chipper -  a nice mood to have
comments.subject: Emoticon

comments.article: It has to be that. I am listening to Dotrice while commuting, for the fourth time to make sure I remember all of Book 3....and just so happen to be at the part where Jamie and Brienne are at Harrenhall...and we all know where that ends up - the bear pit! And this happens before the second of the three weddings (since Sansa/Tyrion is the first, then RW and PW)....so episode 7 is about right.
comments.subject: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

comments.article: The more I thought about it I realized that Book 3 actually has four weddings - S/T, RW, PT and LF/Lysa. It is the wedding book in a weird sort of way. I think S/T and RW are in Season 3 and PW and LF/Lysa are in Season 4. Just my guess.
comments.subject: Re: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
Re: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

comments.article: It's gotta be The Bear and the Maiden Fair.  I know D+D have wanted to do the *other* song-titled episode since the series started.
